cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the construction of optimal locally recoverable codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also makes use of extremal graph theory to improve results, which falls under the category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The paper also discusses the structure of parity-check matrices, which is related to coding theory (cs.DS) and distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also mentions the use of hypergraphs, which is a topic in graph theory (cs.GT). Finally, the paper discusses the length of optimal locally recoverable codes, which is related to complexity theory (cs.CC).
